Class Vector3D

java.lang.Object
raja.Vector3D
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Writable
public class Vector3D extends Object implements Serializable, Writable
The Vector3D class defines a high precision vector in the 3 dimensional space, given by its 3D coordinates. This class provides most of the classical operations on vectors (norm, dot product, cross product, projection...).
See Also:
  • Point3D

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Vector3D(double x, double y, double z)
    Creates a Vector3D object initialized with the specified 3D coordinates.
    Vector3D(Point3D source, Point3D dest)
    Initializes a newly created Vector3D object so that it represents the vector connecting the two specified 3D points.
    Vector3D(Vector3D v)
    Initializes a newly created Vector3D object so that it represents the same 3 dimensional vector as the argument.

  • Constructor Details

    • Vector3D

      public Vector3D(double x, double y, double z)
      Creates a Vector3D object initialized with the specified 3D coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - , y, z the coordinates to which to set the newly constructed Vector3D.

    • Vector3D

      public Vector3D(Vector3D v)
      Initializes a newly created Vector3D object so that it represents the same 3 dimensional vector as the argument. In other words, the newly created Vector3D is a copy of the specified Vector3D.
      Parameters:
      v - a Vector3D object.

    • Vector3D

      public Vector3D(Point3D source, Point3D dest)
      Initializes a newly created Vector3D object so that it represents the vector connecting the two specified 3D points.
      Parameters:
      source - the source Point3D.
      dest - the destination Point3D.

      Returns:

    • normSq

      public double normSq()
      Computes the square of the norm of this Vector3D.
      Returns:
      the square of the norm of this Vector3D.

    • normalization

      public static Vector3D normalization(Vector3D v)
      Computes a normed version of the specified Vector3D. The norm of the Vector3D argument is assumed to be non zero.
      Parameters:
      v - a Vector3D object, whose norm is non zero.
      Returns:
      a normed version of the specified Vector3D.

    • negation

      public Vector3D negation()
      ADDED by Murat Inan Returns a new vector that is the negation of this vector. Each component of the resulting vector is the negative of the corresponding component in this vector.
      Returns:
      A new Vector3D representing the negation of this vector

      public static Vector3D difference(Vector3D v1, Vector3D v2)

    • magnitude

      public double magnitude()
      Returns the magnitude (length) of this vector. This is equivalent to the norm of the vector. ADDED by Murat Inan
      Returns:
      the magnitude of this vector.

    • projection

      public static Vector3D projection(Vector3D v, Vector3D n)
      Computes the projection of the specified Vector3D on the hyperplane given by the specified normal.
      Parameters:
      v - the Vector3D project.
      n - the normal of the hyperplane to project the specified Vector3D on.
      Returns:
      an instance of Vector3D that is the projection of the specified Vector3D on the hyperplane given by the specified normal.

      Returns a textual String representation of this Vector3D object.

    • lengthSquared

      public double lengthSquared()
      Returns the squared length (norm squared) of this vector. This is equivalent to x*x + y*y + z*z. ADDED by Murat Inan
      Returns:
      the squared length of this vector.
